items.title: TechCrunch Disrupt 2025: Only 3 days left for 2-for-1 Pass
items.summary:
- 2-for-1 ticket offer ends January 31 at 11:59 p.m. PT for TechCrunch Disrupt 2025.
- Event date: October 27–29, 2025, at Moscone West, San Francisco.
- Expect over 10,000 tech and VC leaders and 250+ hands-on sessions.

items.title: Clutch grabs $20M to build out its non-human security ID platform
items.author: Ingrid Lunden
items.summary:
- Clutch Security raises $20 million in funding to enhance its non-human identity platform for cybersecurity.
- The funding round is led by SignalFire, with participation from Lightspeed Venture Partners and Merlin Ventures.
- Clutch integrates with nearly 60 infrastructure services to manage machine identities, which have increased from 320,000 in 2022 to 1 million in 2024 in large enterprises.
- The company was founded in October 2023 and focused on addressing security issues exacerbated by cloud computing and AI integration.
- Clutch aims to address vulnerabilities in managed service accounts and predicts a rise in attacks against AI agents in enterprise settings.

items.title: Finout raises $40M Series C for its cloud cost management service
items.author: Frederic Lardinois
items.summary:
- Finout has secured a $40 million Series C funding round, totaling $85 million raised to date.
- The funding comes after notable acquisitions of competitors, creating a unique market opportunity for Finout.
- Finout aims to expand its engineering team and go-to-market efforts using the new funding.
- Customers include major firms like SiriusXM, Lyft, and The New York Times.
- Focus areas include analytics, spending predictions, and promoting FinOps practices in organizations.

items.title: On Tesla earnings day, all eyes are Elon, profits, and AI
items.author: Kirsten Korosec, Sean O’Kane
items.summary:
- Tesla's fourth-quarter earnings report is expected to be released on Wednesday after market close.
- The company delivered 1.77 million vehicles globally in 2024, a decrease of 2.2% from 2023.
- The fourth quarter saw 495,570 vehicles delivered, 7% higher than Q3 and approximately 2.28% more than Q4 2023.
- Tesla's revenue and profit expectations for 2025 will be closely monitored during the earnings call.
- Musk is expected to discuss autonomous technology and Tesla's ambitions in the robotaxi market during the call.
- Previous earnings showed $25.2 billion in sales and a $2.2 billion profit in Q3 2024, with a significant reliance on regulatory credits for income.

items.title: Solar startup Niko is building Mexico’s first virtual power plant
items.author: Edoardo Dellepiane, Raffaele Sertorio, Andrés Marquina, Tim De Chant
items.summary:
- Niko Energy was founded in 2023 to capitalize on Mexico's underdeveloped solar market.
- Recognizing a demand for reliable power, Niko plans to build Mexico’s first virtual power plant (VPP).
- The VPP will manage decentralized energy resources to alleviate pressure on Mexico's strained power grid, particularly during blackouts.
- Niko aims to grow its portfolio of solar installations, targeting both small residential clients and larger corporations.
- The startup raised $8 million in equity and $15 million in debt to support its initiatives.

items.title: DeepSeek’s app becomes unavailable on Apple’s and Google’s app stores in Italy
items.author: Ivan Mehta
items.summary:
- The app DeepSeek is no longer available on Apple’s App Store and Google’s Play Store following a request from Italian authorities for user data handling information.
- DeepSeek's app was highly popular, ranking first in download charts in multiple countries, including the U.S.
- A consumer coalition, Euroconsumers, filed a complaint with the Italian DPA regarding DeepSeek's data practices, with a response deadline of 20 days for the company.
- Concerns arise from DeepSeek storing user information on servers located in China, which is highlighted in their privacy policy.
- Other European data watchdogs have indicated that all services must comply with AI and data protection regulations, without specifically naming DeepSeek.
- Apple and Google have not commented on the situation yet.

items.title: Smiths Group Confirms Cyberattack and Unauthorized Access to Systems
items.summary:
- Smiths Group, a U.K.-based engineering firm, confirmed unauthorized access to its systems amid a cybersecurity incident.
- The company has activated its business continuity plans and isolated affected systems, indicating a potentially disruptive incident like ransomware.
- Smiths is collaborating with cybersecurity experts to recover systems and assess wider business impacts, but details about the attack's nature or data theft have not been disclosed.
- The company employs over 15,000 people across 50 countries and has yet to specify when the attack occurred.

items.title: Uber-backed mobility fintech Moove acquires Brazil’s Kovi, takes ARR to $275M
items.author: Tage Kene-Okafor
items.summary:
- Moove, an Africa-born mobility fintech, acquires Brazilian urban mobility provider Kovi.
- The acquisition is an all-share transaction; Kovi is now wholly owned by Moove.
- Following the acquisition, Moove’s annual revenue rises to $275 million, up from $115 million last March.
- The acquisition solidifies Moove’s position in Brazil, enhancing its operational scale in Latin America, where it’s launched services in Colombia and Mexico.
- Kovi will continue operating under its brand, pending approval from the Brazilian antitrust authority.
- Moove aims to build the largest ride-share fleet, growing from 76 cars in 2020 to 36,000 cars in operation across six continents.

items.title: ChatGPT’s mobile users are 85% male, report says
items.author: Amanda Silberling
items.summary:
- AI app spending surged to $1.42 billion in 2024, a 274% rise from 2023, driven by ChatGPT.
- ChatGPT has 353 million downloads, with 84.5% of users identified as male.
- Over 50% of ChatGPT's mobile users are under 25, while 20.2% are aged 50 to 64.
- A Pew Research report highlights that women express more skepticism towards AI, potentially affecting their usage rates.
- ChatGPT faces competition from DeepSeek, an emerging free and open-source AI app.

items.title: Meteomatics eyes U.S. expansion for its enterprise-focused weather forecasting tools
items.author: Martin Fengler, Becca Szkutak
items.summary:
- Meteomatics, founded by Martin Fengler in 2012, specializes in enterprise weather forecasting by compiling data from over 110 sources and its own drones.
- The company has over 600 clients, including Tesla and CVS Health, and focuses on industries rather than media.
- Recently raised $22 million in Series C funding to expand into the U.S. and enhance technology, aiming for global one-kilometer precision in weather forecasts by the end of Q1 2025.

items.title: DeepSeek’s AI avoids answering 85% of prompts on ‘sensitive topics’ related to China
items.summary:
- DeepSeek, an AI chatbot from Chinese hedge fund High-Flyer, is gaining popularity, topping app store charts as of January 29, 2025.
- It has been reported that the AI avoids 85% of sensitive prompts regarding topics like the Tiananmen Square protests and Taiwan.
- A report from PromptFoo, which explores AI vulnerabilities, indicates that DeepSeek's model has nationalistic canned responses and can be easily jailbroken, suggesting a crude implementation of censorship.
- The dataset of sensitive prompts is available on [Hugging Face](https://huggingface.co/datasets/promptfoo/CCP-sensitive-prompts).

items.title: Microsoft probing whether DeepSeek improperly used OpenAI APIs
items.summary:
- Microsoft is investigating DeepSeek's use of OpenAI’s API following claims of improper usage.
- The investigation was triggered by security researchers suggesting that DeepSeek exfiltrated data from OpenAI’s API in fall 2024.
- OpenAI's terms of service prohibit using the output from their API to develop competing models.

items.title: Formance raises $21M to build the AWS for fintech infrastructure
items.author: Romain Dillet
items.summary:
- Formance, a French startup, raised $21 million in a Series A round co-led by [PayPal Ventures](https://paypal.vc/) and [Portage](https://portageinvest.com/).
- The company focuses on building modular fintech infrastructure, including a programmable financial ledger and a connectivity platform.
- Formance aims to expand its team from 20 to 50 employees by the end of 2025 and plans to open an office in New York.

items.title: This fintech has a fix for the biggest cross-border payments issues in Francophone Africa
items.author: Oumar Rafiou Barry, Abdoulaye Bah
items.summary:
- Cauridor, an Ivorian fintech, raised $3.5 million in seed funding to enhance cross-border payments in Francophone Africa.
- The platform supports mobile wallets, bank transfers, and cash pickups via over 25,000 agents in five countries.
- The founders pivoted to build payment rails in 2022, and by 2023, over 90% of revenue came from this new business model, processing 2 million transactions with significant annual growth.

items.title: Shared scooter startup Voi reports its first profitable year as it explores an IPO
items.author: Rebecca Bellan
items.summary:
- Voi had its first profitable year in 2024 with €132.8 million ($138 million) in net revenue.
- The company reported adjusted earnings before interest and taxes (EBIT) of around €100,000 ($104,000).
- Vehicle profit margins increased to 57%, up from 49% in 2023.
- CEO Frederik Hjelm mentioned improvements in cash positive financials and EBIT profitability confirm suitability for an IPO in 2-3 years.
- Voi has 100,000 vehicles, 90% of which are scooters, and plans significant increases in bike fleet.
- Voi ended 2024 with €60 million ($62 million) in cash and secured €125 million in senior secured bonds in October 2024.

items.title: DeepSeek reaches No. 1 on US Play Store
items.author: Ivan Mehta
items.summary:
- Chinese AI lab DeepSeek's Android app has achieved No. 1 on the Google Play Store soon after topping the Apple App Store.
- The DeepSeek app, launched in mid-January, has over 1.2 million downloads on the Play Store and over 1.9 million on the App Store, with claims of more than 5 million downloads indicated.
- DeepSeek's success follows the release of open-source AI models that compete with those from major AI firms such as OpenAI and Google.
- The app functions as a ChatGPT alternative powered by DeepSeek's V3 model, allowing users to analyze files and sync chat history.
- To establish long-term dominance, DeepSeek aims to reach 300 million weekly users, surpassing OpenAI's ChatGPT.
- DeepSeek has attracted attention from various startups, including Perplexity and Gloo, integrating its capabilities into their systems.

items.title: Naboo secures $21M for its concierge-style corporate event booking platform
items.author: Romain Dillet
items.summary:
- Naboo, a French startup, raised $21 million in a Series A round led by Notion Capital.
- The platform simplifies corporate event booking by bundling accommodation with catering, activities, and transport.
- Company booking volumes quadrupled from €15 million in 2023 to €60 million in 2024.
- Naboo charges an average take-rate of 17% on bookings, generating about €10 million in revenue in 2024.
- 10% of French CAC40 companies have utilized Naboo, including clients like Google and Société Générale.
- Plans to automate tasks and expand to the U.K., where it already generates 10% of its revenue.

items.title: SoftBank to invest $500M in robotics startup SkildAI
items.summary:
- SoftBank is negotiating a $500 million investment in [Skild AI](https://www.skild.ai/), valuing the company at $4 billion.
- Skild AI previously raised $300 million at a $1.5 billion valuation last July.
- The company's AI model is adaptable for various robots, aiming at the intersection of robotics and AI, attracting substantial investor interest, including Jeff Bezos.

items.title: Italy sends first data watchdog request to DeepSeek: ‘The data of millions of Italians is at risk’
items.author: Ingrid Lunden
items.summary:
- The Italian Data Protection Authority (DPA) has filed a complaint against DeepSeek regarding personal data handling under GDPR.
- The complaint emphasizes that millions of Italians' data is at risk, and DeepSeek must respond within 20 days.
- Concerns were raised about how DeepSeek operates in China and the data protection measures it has in place, particularly for minors.

items.title: DeepSeek: Everything you need to know about the AI chatbot app
items.author: Kyle Wiggers
items.summary:
- DeepSeek's chatbot app became the top of the Apple App Store charts, prompting discussions about the U.S. AI market.
- Founded in 2023 as a research lab by High-Flyer Capital Management, DeepSeek developed its models in-house despite facing U.S. hardware export bans.
- Launched models include DeepSeek-V2 and DeepSeek-V3, which outperform existing models from major competitors and have triggered significant market reactions.

items.title: David Sacks claims there’s ‘substantial evidence’ that DeepSeek used OpenAI’s models to train its own
items.summary:
- David Sacks stated there is substantial evidence that DeepSeek used OpenAI's models to train its own in an interview on Fox.  
- Sacks compared the use of OpenAI responses to theft and noted that he believed OpenAI would not be pleased.  
- DeepSeek's apps have gained popularity and topped the Apple App Store, prompting scrutiny from U.S. government officials regarding national security.  
- The U.S. Navy has reportedly banned DeepSeek's AI due to potential security and ethical concerns.

items.title: DeepSeek triggered a wild, baseless rally for some Chinese stocks
items.author: Charles Rollet
items.summary:
- Chinese AI company DeepSeek sparked a sell-off in U.S. tech stocks, with Nvidia losing almost 20%.
- Shares of firms supposedly linked to DeepSeek surged, but there is no evidence of any actual investment or cooperation.
- Key entities like Huajin Capital and Sublime China Information denied any ties to DeepSeek, despite massive stock gains following rumors.
- The speculation originated from unverified lists circulating in China that linked various companies to DeepSeek.

items.title: Figure AI details plan to improve humanoid robot safety in the workplace
items.author: Brian Heater
items.summary:
[Safety of humanoid robots is often overlooked in workplace integration]
[Figure AI is establishing a Center for the Advancement of Humanoid Safety, led by former Amazon Robotics safety engineer Rob Gruendel]
[The firm aims to certify robot safety standards in collaboration with OSHA recognized independent testing laboratories and improve safety measures for robotic systems working alongside humans]

items.title: Tesla Superchargers: GM, Ford, Rivian, and other EV brands with access
items.summary:
- Ford locked in a deal in May 2023 for its EVs to access the Tesla Supercharger network.
- By the end of 2023, most major automakers, including GM and Rivian, agreed to adopt Tesla’s North American Charging Standard (NACS).
- As of January 31, 2025, Lucid Gravity SUV owners will have access to Tesla Superchargers, and existing Lucid Air sedan owners will have access via adapters in Q2 2025.
- GM's EVs gained access to Tesla Superchargers in September 2024, requiring a $225 GM-approved adapter for access.
- Hyundai plans to provide access to NACS chargers for EV owners beginning January 15, 2025, with new EVs featuring NACS plugs.
- Rivian gained access to 15,000 Superchargers on March 18, 2024, with adapters being shipped to customers.
- Mercedes-Benz EVs will access Tesla's network starting February 2025, with approved adapters available for $185.
- Nissan plans to provide access to its Ariya drivers via a NACS adapter starting late 2024.
- Volvo and Polestar began offering access to Tesla’s Supercharger network in late October 2024, with specific adapter availability details.

items.title: Bookshop.org challenges Amazon with new e-book platform
items.author: Amanda Silberling
items.summary:
- Bookshop.org launched an e-book platform to compete with Amazon's dominance in the e-book market.
- The platform aims to support independent bookstores by allowing customers to purchase e-books directly, circumventing Amazon.
- Currently, e-books from Bookshop.org are accessible through web browsers and apps for Android and iOS, with plans to improve compatibility with devices like Kindle.

items.title: Hugging Face researchers are trying to build a more open version of DeepSeek’s AI ‘reasoning’ model
items.author: Kyle Wiggers
items.summary:
- Hugging Face is replicating DeepSeek’s R1 AI model, calling their project Open-R1 to promote open knowledge.
- DeepSeek released R1 with a permissive license but lacks transparency in data and model components, prompting Hugging Face's initiative.
- The Open-R1 project seeks to open source R1’s architecture to enhance transparency and support responsible AI deployment.
- Hugging Face is utilizing their Science Cluster with 768 Nvidia H100 GPUs to generate datasets for the replication.
- The project gained significant community interest, accruing 10,000 stars on GitHub within three days.

items.title: Automattic and others back Openvibe, an app that’s unifying the open social web
items.author: Sarah Perez
items.summary:
- Openvibe's app integrates multiple open social networks including Bluesky, Mastodon, Nostr, and Threads.
- The company raised $800,000 in funding led by Czech Founders VC with investments from Automattic and Tensor Ventures.
- Openvibe initially launched in 2024, providing a user-friendly interface for cross-posting and managing content across different social platforms.
- Plans for the funding include product development acceleration, user base expansion, and enhanced platform integrations.
- Openvibe aims to position itself as a competitive alternative to traditional social media services.

items.title: Eric Schmidt says DeepSeek marks a ‘turning point’ for the global AI race
items.summary:
- Former Google CEO Eric Schmidt calls for increased open-source AI efforts in response to the rise of DeepSeek.
- Schmidt asserts that DeepSeek's emergence represents a turning point in the global AI competition.
- He emphasizes the need for the U.S. to invest in AI infrastructure and promote sharing of training methodologies among leading labs.
- Schmidt has previously advocated for U.S. investments in AI technologies and is linked to various AI projects and startups.

items.title: Who is Liang Wenfeng? DeepSeek founder comes from AI investing
items.summary:
- DeepSeek, a Chinese AI lab, disrupts the American AI scene with its open-source R1 reasoning model that claims to use less computing power.
- The DeepSeek app has become the top app in the App Store, surpassing ChatGPT.
- Liang Wenfeng, founder of DeepSeek, previously founded the investment firm Jacobi and the AI hedge fund High-Flyer, which manages $8 billion.

items.title: Waymo is reportedly building a charity ‘tipping’ feature into its robotaxi app
items.summary:
- Waymo is testing a new feature that allows robotaxi riders to give a tip to their chosen charity after a ride.
- The feature was discovered by researcher Jane Manchun Wong while reverse engineering the Waymo Android app.
- Riders can select a charity from a dropdown menu after clicking an 'add a tip' button.

items.title: Ambi Robotics built a clever solution to automate pallet packing
items.author: Brian Heater
items.summary:
- Ambi Robotics launched AmbiStack, a pallet packing automation system, on January 28, 2025.
- The system features an industrial robotic arm that lifts boxes using suction cups, streamlining the packing process.
- AmbiStack integrates picking and stacking to enhance efficiency and safety, addressing injury risks in human workers.
- Pre-sales have commenced, with first deployments set for mid-2025, and manufacturing expansion planned for early 2026.
- Ambi Robotics, founded in 2018, has raised over $67 million, working with major clients like Pitney Bowes.

items.title: Geek Ventures, a fund that specializes in backing immigrant founders, is raising a second fund
items.author: Dominic-Madori Davis
items.summary:
- Geek Ventures is raising Fund II, as per a recent SEC filing.
- The firm was founded in 2021 by Ihar Mahaniok, who aims to support early-stage immigrant founders.
- It has raised $9 million so far for the new fund, with no target amount specified.
- Geek Ventures previously raised a $23 million debut fund and focuses on sectors like SaaS, hardware, and deep tech.
- The firm has made over 60 investments, including in companies like Spice AI and Saturday.
- The first sale for Fund II was registered on January 13th.

items.title: Documents show UK wooed a16z for five years
items.summary:
- UK’s Department of Business and Trade spent five years trying to persuade Andreessen Horowitz (a16z) to establish an office in London.
- a16z launched a crypto office in London in 2023, citing a more favorable environment compared to the U.S. under Biden.
- Progress on crypto in the U.K. was slow, and with the new Labour government less focused on crypto initiatives, a16z decided to leave after 18 months.

items.title: Amazon’s Prime Air drone service is headed to this UK town
items.author: Brian Heater
items.summary:
- Amazon has chosen Darlington, a town in northern England, as the first site for its U.K. drone delivery service expansion.
- The company had initially planned to expand Prime Air to the U.K. and Italy in 2024 but missed that deadline and is currently in the early stages of development.
- Amazon must still submit planning applications to local authorities and the Civil Aviation Authority before launching.
- Darlington residents will be consulted for feedback on the expansion plans.
- Prime Air began operations in June 2022 in California but ended drone deliveries there in April 2024, citing resource prioritization.
- The service has delivered thousands of packages in the U.S. with a target delivery time of under an hour.

items.title: Waymo begins testing robotaxis on LA freeways
items.author: Kirsten Korosec
items.summary:
- Waymo is testing its robotaxis on Los Angeles freeways including Interstates 10, 110, 405, and 90.
- Initial access to driverless vehicles will be offered to employees before expanding to the public.
- The move aims to improve service efficiency, with freeway routes potentially reducing travel time by up to 50%. 
- Waymo has been mapping the LA area since 2019 and aims to operate commercially in the city by leveraging its freeway system.

items.title: This startup is selling for $1B, so why is its founder not proud of the outcome?
items.author: Mary Ann Azevedo
items.summary:
- Divvy Homes is selling to Brookfield Properties for $1 billion, down from a $2 billion valuation in 2021.
- CEO Adena Hefets stated that many shareholders, particularly common shareholders and Series FF preferred stockholders, will not receive any proceeds from the sale due to significant debt payments.
- Divvy faced challenges such as a surge in interest rates in 2022 and complaints about property maintenance and overcharging for rents. Hefets admitted she was "not proud of the financial outcome."

items.title: This founder was worried about his mother slipping — so he created sensors to detect falls
items.author: Kyle Wiggers
items.summary:
- Falls are the leading cause of injury for adults aged 65 and older, with roughly 10% requiring medical attention.
- George Netscher founded SafelyYou to develop a tech solution for detecting falls in seniors, leveraging AI sensors and cameras.
- The technology notifies staff immediately when a fall is detected, aiming to provide timely assistance.
- SafelyYou is serving nearly 1,000 senior living communities after overcoming challenges during the COVID-19 pandemic.
- Recently raised $43 million in Series C funding, bringing total investment to over $100 million to support expansion.

items.title: Google Play adds a ‘Verified’ badge for trusted VPN apps
items.author: Aisha Malik
items.summary:
- Google Play introduces a ‘Verified’ badge for trusted VPN apps to enhance user confidence in app safety.
- The badge signifies that the app developers have followed Play safety guidelines and have undergone a Mobile Application Security Assessment (MASA) Level 2 validation.
- To qualify for the badge, a VPN app must have a minimum of 10,000 installs, 250 reviews, be on Google Play for at least 90 days, and meet API level requirements.
- The badge will be displayed on the app's detail page and search results to help users find reliable VPN options.
- This initiative is part of Google’s ongoing effort to flag safe apps, following the introduction of 'Government' labels in May 2024.

items.title: Reelo stands out among the apps building a ‘TikTok for Bluesky’
items.author: Sarah Perez
items.summary:
- Reelo is an upcoming video-first app for the open-source social network [Bluesky](https://techcrunch.com/2024/09/10/what-is-bluesky-everything-to-know-about-the-app-trying-to-replace-twitter/).
- Unlike other apps, Reelo builds on the AT Protocol, allowing it to support longer videos, filters, and livestreaming.
- Developer João Davi Souza Nascimento aims for a March launch, focusing on creator tools and monetization models that are more competitive with TikTok.
- Reelo will allow videos up to three minutes long, compared to Bluesky's one-minute limit, and will feature a swipeable vertical video feed.
- Users will be able to interoperate with Bluesky, posting videos back as an optional feature, and multiple feeds will be offered.

items.title: ChatGPT: Everything you need to know about the AI-powered chatbot
items.summary:
- ChatGPT, OpenAI's AI chatbot, launched in November 2022, has reached 300 million weekly active users.
- In 2024, OpenAI partnered with Apple and released features like GPT-4o with voice capability and a text-to-video model called Sora.
- The company experienced management changes and faced lawsuits for copyright infringements while continuing to innovate with features like real-time video and reminder scheduling.

items.title: Boom’s XB-1 becomes first civil aircraft to go supersonic
items.author: Sean O’Kane
items.summary:
- Boom Supersonic’s XB-1 plane just went supersonic in the Mojave desert, marking it as the first civil aircraft to break the sound barrier.
- The achievement occurred during its twelfth test flight, reaching Mach 1.1 for about four minutes.
- The XB-1 is a prototype for Boom's future 64-passenger airliner called [Overture](https://boomsupersonic.com/overture).
- The supersonic flight took place eight years after XB-1 was first announced, and a second test flight could occur soon.
- Boom CEO Blake Scholl highlighted the significance of the event, comparing it to SpaceX’s first rocket reaching orbit.

items.title: Jetify launches Testpilot, its AI QA engineer
items.author: Frederic Lardinois
items.summary:
- Jetify launches AI agent named [Testpilot](https://www.jetify.com/) aimed at simplifying routine test creation.
- Currently supports web applications; mobile testing is planned for future release.
- CEO Daniel Loreto describes the launch as a pivot towards AI solutions for software development lifecycle improvement.
- AI tools handle UI testing more robustly compared to existing tools like Selenium.
- Testpilot requires only access to the application for testing, not to the underlying code repositories.

items.title: GM expects to save up to $1 billion on Cruise costs
items.author: Rebecca Bellan
items.summary:
- General Motors anticipates up to $1 billion annual savings by halting its Cruise robotaxi program.
- CEO Mary Barra announced a restructuring to focus on personal autonomous vehicles, following an earlier decision to stop funding Cruise.
- The move comes after GM reported a $2.9 billion loss for Q4 2024, largely due to charges related to this decision, including a one-time $500 million charge and a $4 billion restructuring charge.
- Cruise expenses were reported at $400 million in the last quarter, down from $800 million in 2023.
- Most Cruise employees are uncertain about their future roles as GM integrates Cruise personnel into its main operations, with retention offers being extended to some staff.

items.title: Quibim raises $50M to develop AI models for medical imaging
items.author: Paul Sawers
items.summary:
- Quibim, a Spanish startup, raised $50 million in a Series A funding round to develop AI models for medical imaging.
- The company focuses on oncology, immunology, neurology, and metabolic disorders, aiming to enhance diagnostic accuracy through visual data from imaging scans.
- Quibim plans to expand its presence in the U.S. after receiving FDA clearance for its QP-Prostate product and has around 170 installations globally, collaborating with notable institutions such as Stanford University and Mass General Brigham.

items.title: Apple fixes zero-day flaw affecting all devices
items.author: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
items.summary:
- Apple released updates for iPhone, iPad, and Mac, which included switching on Apple Intelligence by default for newer devices.
- Security patches included a fix for a zero-day bug that may have been actively exploited, affecting iPhones running software older than iOS 17.2.
- The bug was found in Core Media and allowed hackers to elevate privileges and access data on devices.
- This is the first exploited bug found in iOS this year; Apple fixed at least seven similar bugs in 2024.

items.title: Hugging Face makes it easier for devs to run AI models on third-party clouds
items.author: Kyle Wiggers
items.summary:
- Hugging Face has launched Inference Providers in partnership with third-party cloud vendors like SambaNova, Fal, Replicate, and Together AI.
- The new feature allows developers to run AI models using various infrastructures easily.
- Users can deploy models without managing hardware, benefiting from automatic resource scaling by providers.
- Hugging Face provides credits for inference usage, with standard API rates for cloud provider services.

items.title: Trump says Microsoft is in talks to acquire TikTok
items.summary:
- President Trump announced that Microsoft is in talks to acquire TikTok's U.S. operations.
- Trump indicated there is significant interest in TikTok, with multiple bidders expected.
- Microsoft and Oracle were previously interested in acquiring TikTok in 2020 due to ownership concerns.
- Trump signed an executive order delaying the TikTok ban deadline by 75 days and advised the DOJ not to enforce penalties.
- The app remains unavailable in app stores despite being back online.
- Other bidders include Perplexity AI and billionaire Frank McCourt, with potential interest from Elon Musk and Larry Ellison.

items.title: X announces a partnership with Visa to power X Money’s wallet
items.author: Ivan Mehta
items.summary:
- X, owned by Elon Musk, announced a partnership with Visa for person-to-person payments for its upcoming X Money product.
- Visa Direct will be used for real-time money transfers, allowing loading money into X Money, connecting with debit cards for payments, and transferring to bank accounts.
- CEO Linda Yaccarino stated this is the first of many announcements related to X Money, which will officially debut later this year.
- Musk has previously expressed a vision to make X a financial platform, aiming for features like tipping and high-yield balances.
- X has obtained money transmitter licenses in more than 40 U.S. states for its X Payments subsidiary, indicating progress towards the launch of the payment service.

items.title: PowerSchool begins notifying students and teachers after massive data breach
items.author: Carly Page
items.summary:
- PowerSchool is notifying individuals affected by a December 2024 data breach impacting millions in North America.
- Attackers accessed sensitive data via a compromised account, which lacked multi-factor authentication.
- Initial reports suggest up to 62 million students and 9.5 million teachers may be affected, but exact numbers are still under review.
- The breach particularly impacted the Toronto District School Board (TDSB), with almost 1.5 million students’ data stolen, including personal and medical information.
- Other affected institutions include the Calgary Board of Education, West Ada School District, and Alexandria City Public Schools, all reporting stolen personal data.

items.title: OpenAI launches ChatGPT plan for U.S. government agencies
items.summary:
- OpenAI has launched ChatGPT Gov to provide U.S. government agencies with an AI-powered chatbot platform.
- ChatGPT Gov offers capabilities from the corporate-focused ChatGPT Enterprise and allows deployment on Microsoft Azure clouds.
- Since 2024, over 90,000 users in U.S. government agencies have sent more than 18 million messages via ChatGPT to assist in their work.
